column2: Ltd.,  vs.  Asher  [1949]  2  All  E.  R.  155,  (to  which  the  lord  justice  himself
refers) cannot be supported. It appears to me to be a naked usurpation

column1: 9 Sir Edward Coke did not write the judgment in Heydon’s case (1584). He became a Judge for the first time in
1585, the next year, when he was 33 years old. Hence Viscount Simond’s argument is wrong on this aspect too.
